name: The Willow Mouth
tagline: An airy wood of little brooks and bendy, old willow trees.
description: An airy wood of little brooks and bendy, old willow trees.

points_of_interest.name: The Willow's Pool
points_of_interest.description: Following the lay of the land and the gentle flow of the water leads down to a wide pool covered in algae and lily pads, surrounded by willows. Animals of the wood seem to shun this pool.
points_of_interest.interior: At one end of the pool stands an enormous willow tree, unusually thick, with a gigantic (10′ tall) human mouth in the base of its trunk: the Great Willow.
points_of_interest.exploring: Characters who feed the willow a large animal notice that its throat leads to a cavernous area beneath the tree: the Willow's Gullet. Three white cows, standing still, undigested and fully intact, can be glimpsed in the gullet.
special_features: Animals of the wood shun this pool
Gigantic 10′ tall human mouth in willow trunk

points_of_interest.name: The Willow's Gullet / Shrine to St Gripe
points_of_interest.description: A humid, foetid chamber. Tree roots pulse in the walls like veins. The walls and floor ripple unnervingly.
points_of_interest.entering: Characters who feed the willow a large animal can access through the willow's throat
points_of_interest.interior: Visitors discover that the undigested cows are in fact statues of cows, standing on a thick wooden platform. Amongst them is a fourth statue (not visible from the surface): St Gripe the forthright, depicted as a young man leading the cows, his expression wary and watchful.
points_of_interest.exploring: With heavy labour and some cajoling of the Great Willow to open its mouth wide, adventurers can remove the statues and platform, soothing the Willow and restoring the shrine.
special_features: Tree roots pulse in walls like veins
secrets: The undigested cows are actually statues

npcs.name: The Great Willow
npcs.description: A miraculous, magical creation of the Dolmenwood: a huge willow tree with a human mouth. The mouth emits loud moans, as if hungry.
desires: The Great Willow is voraciously carnivorous, but has no way of getting food into its gullet. Due to its size, only whole sheep, deer, cattle, horses, etc. can provide the willow with a satisfying meal
The Willow also seeks relief from the indigestion caused by the white cows and allows characters to safely enter its mouth if they offer aid
secrets: Knows a great deal about surrounding hexes
May be able to answer obscure questions posed by adventurers

items.name: St Gripe's Blessing
items.description: After restoring the shrine, characters praying may receive the blessing of St Gripe: the ability to cast Find Traps

secrets: The shrine to St Gripe is hidden in the Willow's Gullet
Prayer at the restored shrine grants Find Traps ability
dm_notes: In exchange for food or relief from the dyspepsia-inducing nuisance of the white cows, the willow mouth can offer knowledge about surrounding hexes and may answer obscure questions.
